result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Austin Taylor Koeckeritz

records.addlTxt: Motion hearing on January 24, 2023 at 09:00 am.
Transcript:  10/20/2022 - Arraignment / Bail Motion Hearing
filed by DA Halle Hatch. eif

Atty Bosworth: proceed with bond motion. DA Hatch did not have time to file a written response. Atty Bosworth gives argument for bond modification: Def has retained expense private counsel, his bank accounts have been seized, and addresses other factors for setting cash bond.DA Hatch: gives argument and requests the court deny the motion. Court: denies the motion and the no contact to remain. Atty Bosworth requests no contact exception be only through attorney's, for the corporation. Court denies the request.  Atty Bosworth gives argument for the exception for the no contact. DA Hatch objects; no lawsuit has been filed. Court denies the request again. Atty Bosworth continues request. Court: Atty Bosworth to file a motion and DA Hatch to respond.

2:46 PM Defendant Austin Taylor Koeckeritz appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Katie J Bosworth appeared by video for Austin Taylor Koeckeritz.  Attorney Halle E. Hatch in court for State of Wisconsin. DA Hatch: information mirrors complaint. Court reads charges and possible penalties. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and constitutional rights. Defendant understands charges, penalties and constitutional rights  Atty Bosworth enters a NG on behalf of client. Court enters. Atty Bosworth request a status conference.
Status conference scheduled for December 19, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on December 19, 2022 at 10:00 am.

2:41 PM Defendant Austin Taylor Koeckeritz appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Katie J Bosworth appeared by video for Austin Taylor Koeckeritz.  Attorney Halle E. Hatch in court for State of Wisconsin.  Judge Clark and DAR appeared via zoom. Court goes over the Defendant's right to have a preliminary hearing. Court finds defendant freely, intelligently and knowingly waives constitutional right to a preliminary hearing.
Waiver of Prelim on October 20, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Arraignment on October 20, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

22SW102
The original document was titled: Search warrant filed 22SW102
The original history event date is: 09-12-2022
The original document was titled: Return of search warrant 22SW102
The original history event date is: 09-12-2022
Victim Request to Appear Remotely Via zoom
of Judge filed by Atty Katie Bosworth. eif

1:06 PM Defendant Austin Taylor Koeckeritz in court, in custody.  Attorney Katie J Bosworth in court for Austin Taylor Koeckeritz.  Attorney Halle E. Hatch in court for State of Wisconsin.  Victim appeared via zoom. Atty Bosworth gives argument for bond motion re: cash bond standards, privately retained - cash is not needed to ensure his appearance, Def would surrender passport. Atty Bosworth requests a $15,000 cash bond, release on EHM or  post real property as bond. DA Hatch gives argument against the modification of bond- recites amounts in bank accounts, requests it not be lower than $150,000 and forfeiture of firearms. State objects to reduction/modification of bond. Atty Bosworth responds- joint bank account with complaintant and addresses civil issues. Court: not entertaining civil issues. Court: reviewed statutes/factors to be considered when setting bond. Court does find cash is necessary for this case as well as the amount of cash, court addresses the factors for determining bond; ability to post, severity of the charges/penalties, are the charges violent, prior records, character of the Def, character strength of the evidence, whether the Def is on probation,  no finding of probable cause or bind, no forfeiture of bail, has not been a fugitive of justice- Court has to provide the proper weight to the factors, Court has to be taken all together. One firearm is missing, there was a threat, that is significate. Court this case has serious consequences. Court finds cash is necessary to ensure the Defendant's appearance in court, finds the $300,000 cash bond previously ordered is appropriate and will remain as ordered.  Court denies request to post real property in lieu of cash. No contact provision will remain. 2:22

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt:
4:01 PM Austin Taylor Koeckeritz appears in custody from Jail via zoom, Atty Morgan Richie, DA Halle Hatch appears for the State of Wisconsin. Victim appears by phone.Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and constitutional rights. Defendant understands charges, possible penalties and constitutional rights. Waives reading. Court reviews DE's rights. DA Hatch is requesting a $500,000.00 Cash bond w/conditions of No contact w/M.N.L., her mothers residence of family, No contact w/V.R.K. or her residence, No contact w/Zachary Pyle or anyone under the age of 18 yrs, no firearms, forfeiture of firearms and Absolute Sobriety, Atty Richie argues. DA Hatch responds. Victim makes a statement and is requesting the No contact and Cash bond. Court orders a $300,000.00 cash bond w/conditions as requested. DE waives time limits. Court confirms address and phone number. Court adjourned at 4:25 pm.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on September 23, 2022 at 10:00 am.
